Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery open vessel, possibly a Simple Animal Style bowl; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (very worn) below; exterior: dot and chequer pattern at rim, reserved below; inscription on interior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted on Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.260. Although Lemos identifies the sherd as belonging to a chalice, the shape of the rim is unusual in Chian wares, thus suggesting that the sherd does not come from a chalice but rather a wide open vessel. Although bowls are not typical of the Simple Animal Style, the rim pattern is consistent with the Sphinx and Lion and Simple Animal Style. However, the lack of decoration on the exterior surface of the sherd is consistent only with the Simple Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no.1092)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 677, no. 362)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2045) (phase 2)
